events.message: Customer reported a car accident that damaged the front bumper and hood after collision with another vehicle.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on keywords detected in initial report about vehicle damage.
Assigned an insurance agent specialized in auto claims to assist the customer with the processing and next steps.
Customer acknowledged receipt of claim confirmation and expressed relief that the process has started promptly.
Requested police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates from the customer to support the insurance claim review.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report and multiple photos showing accident damages.
Claims specialist began investigation reviewing submitted evidence and contacting third parties involved in the accident.
Completed investigation concluded the customer was not at fault based on police report and witness statements.
Proposed settlement amount was communicated to customer covering full repair costs and rental vehicle expenses.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement proposal and quick claim handling.
Approval of the claim was finalized internally after confirming all conditions were met for payout.
Final payment was issued to the repair shop and rental agency as per the approved settlement agreement.
Claim was officially closed in the system and customer notified of closure and resolution completeness.
All claim documentation was archived securely to comply with record-keeping policies for future reference.
